course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Understanding Chinese Politics
course.description: After an historical and organizational introduction to Chinese politics, this course uses concepts such as political participation, bureaucratic politics, state-society relations, and political economy, to explain the development of the People's Republic of China.

reviews.author: duang
reviews.title: More like a biweekly panel discussion
reviews.comment_content:
This is the PG version of SOSC 4600, in which all students gather around and have discussions under assigned topic.
This class is for more advanced UG students and PG students who want to increase their  theoretical  and  historical  understanding  of  Chinese  politics. It  presents  conceptual frameworks and theories about Chinese politics, analyzes key events in the post-1949 period, and  looks  at  many  important  issues  related  to  contemporary  Chinese  politics.  The  purpose, above all, is to try to explain why events occur the way they do in the PRC.
reviews.comment_teaching:
This is the last semester professor Zweig teach this course and I think he is really good at inspiring students and referring to some detailed knowledge.
You will feel this class is more like a panel discussion rather than a course, everyone can raise doubts anytime.
reviews.comment_grading:
30% Leading a discussion in class on 2 questions during the semester.
40% Research Paper
(UG students will write a 20 page paper, PGs will write 25 pages)
30%  Final Exam
reviews.comment_workload: Very heavy, especially for PG students, the weekly reading assignments are more than you can imagine. Please pay enough attention and energy into this course, you can gain more than you can imagine, too.
